meanings.definition: To reject or prohibit a decision or proposal
meanings.sent1: The president vetoed the new law.
meanings.sent2: She always vetoes any changes to the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The cat vetoed the idea of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness vetoed any compromise on the matter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen vetoed any mistakes in the essay.

meanings.definition: Having been denied or blocked by a veto
meanings.sent1: The vetoed bill was not passed by the congress.
meanings.sent2: She felt disappointed by the vetoed decision.
meanings.sent3: The vetoed cake left the party guests craving for dessert.
meanings.sent4: His vetoed request for time off made him work through the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The vetoed invitation left her feeling excluded from the event.
